front.title: Use Cases for Content Delivery Network Interconnection

abstract.t: Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) are commonly used for improving the footprint and the end-user experience of a content delivery service, at a reasonable cost. This document outlines real world use-cases (not technical solutions) for interconnecting CDNs. It can be used to provide guidance to the CDNI WG about the interconnection arrangements to be supported and to validate the requirements of the various CDNI interfaces. This document describes a number of use cases that motivate CDN Interconnection. It represents a work in progress and may be extended later to cover additional use-cases.
